issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: TiAPI
components.description: This component is used for cross-platform API work. Specifications are most likely to use this component.

fields.description:
h2. Expected result

Ti.Locale.getString() and it's alias L() shouldn't accept a function as an argument. Both should throw an error is one is supplied.

h2. Actual result

You can pass arbitrary functions, for example:

Ti.Locale.getString(alert('foo'))  <- shows the alert box
Ti.Locale.getString(console.log('foo'))  <- logs to the console
fields.summary: TiAPI: Ti.Locale.getString() and L() accept arbitrary functions

comments.body: Closing due to inactivity. If this issue still exists, please raise a new ticket.
